intro: Harpochloa, commonly known as the harpochloa grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to various regions of Africa, particularly in southern and eastern parts. The plants are typically perennial and characterized by their slender, tufted growth habit. Harpochloa species often have narrow leaves and produce small, spike-like inflorescences. These grasses are adapted to a variety of habitats, including grasslands and rocky areas.
